tool_description: Develop a robust Biblical interface for your application, featuring scripture and audio narration, and enhance it with the ability to access original texts in Hebrew and Greek. Additionally, integrate functionalities such as cross-references, advanced search capabilities, and access to Strong's Concordance for a comprehensive biblical study tool.
name: IQ Bible
title: IQ Bible

api_list.name: GetChapterCountExtraBiblical- NEW!
api_list.description: Get the chapter count of any extra-biblical book by its id.

api_list.name: GetBookNameExtraBiblicalByBookId - NEW!
api_list.description: Returns the name of an extra-biblical book per the number sent in the request.

api_list.name: GetTopic - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint will return JSON containing all of the citations (e.g., 1 Corinthians 13:4-8) as well as the 'verseIds' (if more than one, they will be arrayed) that apply to the value of the topic parameter entered (e.g., 'love').

api_list.name: GetBibleReadingPlanByTopic - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint will return a Bible Reading Plan specific to the value of the 'topic' parameter. Please note that when using this endpoint, not as many days can be assigned per the 'days' parameter as with the 'GetBibleReadingPlan' endpoint, but you can easily ascertain how many 'verseIds' any topic will produce by using the 'GetTopicVerseCount' endpoint (e.g., GetTopicVerseCount?topic=angels). If the 'days' parameter is not set, the value will default to '30'. If the 'topic' parameter is not set, the default will be the first topic (addiction).

api_list.name: GetReadingTimeByAge
api_list.description: This response contains information about how long, on average, it should take a reader of a specified age to read a number of words.

api_list.name: GetBibleReadingPlan
api_list.description: This endpoint will return a Bible reading plan dividing the Bible into chapters according to the days specified. There are optional parameters that you can set after the required 'days' parameter.

api_list.name: GetTopics - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint will return the JSON array for all of the available topics that can be used with the 'GetTopic' endpoint, q.v.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetTopics"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetTopics"

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetTopicVerseCount - NEW!
api_list.description: Will return a verse count for any topic parameter value.

api_list.name: GetEndpoints - NEW!
api_list.description: Retrieves a list of all available public endpoints in the API.

api_list.name: GetChapterExtraBiblical - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint provides access to individual chapters from a wide range of extra-biblical texts. These texts, not included in the standard biblical canon, encompass a diverse array of writings such as apocryphal, deuterocanonical, and other ancient religious documents.

api_list.name: GetBooksExtraBiblical - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint retrieves a list of all the extra-biblical books available.
api_list.code:

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetAudioNarration
api_list.description: Returns the audio narration file for the Bible chapter in the version specified. Currently supported versions: KJV, RV1909 (Reina Valera 1909 (Spanish)), and SVD (Smith-Van Dyke (Arabic)).

api_list.name: GetBooks
api_list.description: Returns a list of all of the books of the Bible in the language specified with the '?language=[language]' parameter. Currently supported languages are English, Spanish, and Arabic; with more on the way.

api_list.name: GetParables - NEW!
api_list.description: Produces a list of parables in the Bible and their relative citations (e.g., 'GetParables?language=english'). The verses of the parables can be retrieved in your app by using the 'GetParseCitation' call (q.v.). For example, for the last parable, 'The Sheep and the Goats', we can retrieve the 'verseIds' for that parable with this call: 'GetParseCitation?citation=Matthew 25:31-46'.

api_list.name: GetChapterByBookAndChapterId - NEW!
api_list.description: Developed to use with the 'GetBibleReadingPlan', it returns a complete Bible chapter according to the 'bookAndChapterId' and 'versionId' submitted.

api_list.name: GetSearchAdvanced - NEW!
api_list.description:
Advanced Search is a more powerful search than the 'GetSearch' GET request. For example, 'GetSearchAdvanced?query=David&versionId=kjv&matchType=exact&excludeString=urias&limitToBookId=40&limitToChapterId=1' will search for 'David' in the KJV and exclude any mention of 'Urias' within the book of Matthew (bookId: '40') and within chapter '1' only.

The 'matchType' parameter can be set to 'broad' or 'exact'. A broad setting will include any general matches, for example, 'GetSearchAdvanced?query=da&versionId=kjv&matchType=broad' will return all instances wherein the string, 'da', is found. So, a verse containing, 'darkness' would be considered correct. However, if we limit the search to exact with the 'matchType' parameter, only an exact match would return. For example, 'GetSearchAdvanced?query=da&versionId=kjv&matchType=exact' would give back an empty response.

api_list.name: GetStrongs
api_list.description: Returns Strong's in Hebrew or Greek. The [id] in the JSON returned corresponds to the 'H' for Hebrew and 'G' for Greek that Strong's uses to precede the id. Thus, an [id] of 3 in our table is equivalent to Strong's Hebrew H3 as well as Strong's Greek G3. The Strong's id needed can be ascertained after using a GetOriginalText call (e.g. 'GetOriginalText?verseId=01001001') wherein we can receive back the Strong's Ids for any word in Hebrew or Greek respectively.

api_list.name: GetBookAndChapterNameByBookAndChapterId - NEW!
api_list.description: Returns the name of the book and chapter as specified in the 'bookAndChapterId' and 'language' parameter values. Both parameters are required.

api_list.name: GetBookNameByVerseId
api_list.description: Returns the name of the book per the verseId sent in the language specified. For example, 'GetBookNameByVerseId?verseId=40001001&language=english' would return 'Matthew'.

api_list.name: GetBookNameByBookId
api_list.description: Returns the name of the book per the number sent in the language specified. For example, 'GetBookNameByBookId?bookId=01&language=english' would return 'Genesis'.

api_list.name: GetParseCitation
api_list.description: Returns all of the verseIds for the citation submitted. You can use abbreviations (e.g., Ex., or Exod. for Exodus) and multiple references within the same chapter. Also, see GetBibleBookAbbreviations for an array of abbreviations.

api_list.name: GetHebrewCharactersAndUnicodePoints
api_list.description: Returns the Unicode for the Hebrew alphabet and corresponding English transliterations (based on the Unicode standard). The response includes letters, points, accents, punctuation, marks, signs, and Yiddish ligatures.

api_list.name: GetOriginalText
api_list.description: Will return either the Hebrew or the Greek depending on the Testament assessed from the verseId. There are thirty-nine (39) books in the Old Testament (OT).

api_list.name: GetWordCountOfBook - NEW!
api_list.description: Provides a count of all of the words in the specified book.

api_list.name: GetWordCountOfVerse - NEW!
api_list.description: This endpoint's response will contain a count of all of the words of any given verse.

api_list.name: GetBooksOT
api_list.description: Returns a list of only the Old Testament books in the language specified with the '?language=[language]' parameter.

api_list.name: GetBibleBookAbbreviations
api_list.description: GetBibleBookAbbreviations will return an array of all the abbreviations for bible book names. Also see, GetParseCitation.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetBibleBookAbbreviations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetBibleBookAbbreviations"

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetChapter
api_list.description: Returns a complete Bible chapter. Required parameters: bookId, chapterId, and versionId. For example, 'GetChapter?bookId=01&chapterId=02&versionId=kjv' would return the entire second chapter of Genesis in the King James Version.

api_list.name: GetChapterCount
api_list.description: Returns simply the number of chapters in any book requested via the 'bookId' parameter. For example, 'GetChapterCount?bookId=66' would return '22' as their are twenty-two (22) chapters in Revelation - the 66th book.

api_list.name: GetCrossReferences
api_list.description: Returns all of the complete cross-references (with starting and ending verse, if applicable) for the verseId received.

api_list.name: GetInfo
api_list.description: GetInfo will return information about this API.
api_list.code:

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetParallelVerses
api_list.description: Returns the verse according to the verseId sent in all of the versions available.

api_list.name: GetRandomChapter
api_list.description: Returns a random chapter in its entirety.

api_list.name: GetStories
api_list.description: Will return a JSON containing all of the stories by their starting and ending verse of the Bible. Currently, only in English (?language=english), but more are in active development.

api_list.name: GetWords
api_list.description: Will return a word-by-word JSON array of the specified verse, along with the word count.

api_list.name: GetVerse
api_list.description: Will return a single verse from the Bible using the 'verseId', which is composed of eight (8) digits. The first two (2) are the book number, the second three (3), the chapter number, and the last three (3) are the verse number.

api_list.name: GetWordsOfJesus
api_list.description: This endpoint will return an array of all the verseIds wherein Jesus spoke - just as you would find in a 'red letter edition' bible. This endpoint does not take any parameters.
api_list.code:

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetWordsOfJesus"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetGreekCharactersAndUnicode
api_list.description: Returns the Unicode for the Greek alphabet in both lower and uppercase.

api_list.name: GetVersions - NEWLY UPDATED!
api_list.description:
Will return an array of the bible versions available in the API.

Because Bible versions are standardized across the world, we do not attempt to translate versions programmatically.

English versions: ASV (American Standard 1901), BBE (Bible in Basic English), DBY (Darby English Bible), KJV (King James Version), KJV1611 (King James Version 1611), WBT (Webster Bible), WEB (World English Bible), YLT (Young Literal Translation)

Spanish version: RV1909 (Reina-Valera 1909)

Arabic version: SVD (Smith-Van Dyke)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com/GetVersions"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "iq-bible.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GetWordCountOfChapter - NEW!
api_list.description: This will return a count of all of the words in any given chapter.

api_list.name: GetParseVerseId - NEW!
api_list.description: Parses any 'verseId' to return additional IDs for books, chapters, and verses.

api_list.name: GetRandomVerse - NEWLY UPDATED!
api_list.description: Returns a random verse from the Bible (Old Testament or New Testament). The 'GetRandomVerse' has been newly updated and now features advanced filter parameters, such as limiting the random verse to the New or Old Testament, limiting the random verse to a specific book; or a specific book and chapter. E.g., 'GetRandomVerse?versionId=kjv&limitToBookId=20&limitToChapterId=1' will limit to the book of Proverbs, chapter '1'. Or, 'GetRandomVerse?versionId=kjv&limitToBookId=20' will limit to the book of Proverbs, any chapter. If no parameters are added after 'versionId', a random verse from the entire Bible will be requested.

api_list.name: GetCommentary
api_list.description: Returns a commentary in plain text for the commentary name and verse specified. Required parameters: commentaryName, and verseId. Note: Currently, Gill's Commentary is available with more scheduled to be added in the future.

api_list.name: GetDefinitionBiblical
api_list.description: Returns the biblical definition of a query. Currently, Smith's Bible Dictionary is available with more scheduled to be added in the future.

api_list.name: GetVerseCount
api_list.description: Returns the number of verses for the specified book and chapter.

api_list.name: GetBookIdByBookName
api_list.description: Returns the bookId of the bookName submitted. At this time, abbreviations, such as with the GetParseCitation endpoint are not supported, but will be in the future.

api_list.name: GetPropheciesFulfilledInJesus
api_list.description: Returns the prophecies fulfilled in Jesus.

api_list.name: GetSearchCount
api_list.description: GetSearchCount will return the total count of results for any search term (query) entered. For example, 'GetSearchCount?query=Jesus&versionId=kjv' will return 943 - the number of times that the word, "Jesus" appears in the KJV.

api_list.name: GetSearch
api_list.description: Will return all the results of the query entered. For example, 'GetSearch?query=Jesus&versionId=kjv ' will return all the results of the Bible wherein 'Jesus' is found.

api_list.name: GetBooksNT
api_list.description: Returns a list of only the New Testament books in the language specified with the '?language=[language]' parameter.
